channel.title: CVE Feed for Fortinet -- FortiAnalyzer
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fortinet -- FortiAnalyzer

item.title: CVE-2022-42477|2024-10-23T14:29:14.227Z -- fortinet -- fortianalyzer
item.description: An improper input validation vulnerability [CWE-20] in FortiAnalyzer version 7.2.1 and below, version 7.0.6 and below, 6.4 all versions may allow an authenticated attacker to disclose file system information via custom dataset SQL queries.

item.title: CVE-2023-22642|2024-10-23T14:28:22.085Z -- fortinet -- fortianalyzer
item.description: An improper certificate validation vulnerability [CWE-295] in FortiAnalyzer and FortiManager 7.2.0 through 7.2.1, 7.0.0 through 7.0.5, 6.4.8 through 6.4.10 may allow a remote and unauthenticated attacker to perform a Man-in-the-Middle attack on the communication channel between the device and the remote FortiGuard server hosting outbreakalert ressources.

item.title: CVE-2024-45330|2024-10-08T16:00:13.750Z -- fortinet -- fortianalyzer
item.description: A use of externally-controlled format string in Fortinet FortiAnalyzer versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.3, 7.2.2 through 7.2.5 allows attacker to escalate its privileges via specially crafted requests.

item.title: CVE-2023-44254|2024-09-10T17:13:19.223Z -- fortinet -- fortianalyzer
item.description: An authorization bypass through user-controlled key [CWE-639] vulnerability in FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.1 and before 7.2.5 and FortiManager version 7.4.1 and before 7.2.5 may allow a remote attacker with low privileges to read sensitive data via a crafted HTTP request.

item.title: CVE-2023-44254|2024-09-10T14:37:45.294Z -- fortinet -- fortianalyzer
item.description: An authorization bypass through user-controlled key [CWE-639] vulnerability in FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.1 and before 7.2.5 and FortiManager version 7.4.1 and before 7.2.5 may allow a remote attacker with low privileges to read sensitive data via a crafted HTTP request.

item.title: CVE-2024-45330|2024-10-08T14:19:03.894Z -- fortinet -- fortianalyzer
item.description: A use of externally-controlled format string in Fortinet FortiAnalyzer versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.3, 7.2.2 through 7.2.5 allows attacker to escalate its privileges via specially crafted requests.
